alert.note: Alert for Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 7:26PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Wake County through 830 PM EDT... At 726 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wake Forest, or 13 miles northeast of Raleigh, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Raleigh, Wake Forest, Zebulon, RDU International, Knightdale, Wendell, Rolesville, Falls Lake Boat Ramp, Purnell and William B Umstead State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
